From " water ", " wife " sound. The original meaning is the emergence of clouds with rain (Duan Yucai).

Oracle bone inscriptions start with " water " from " wife ", but the inscriptions are incomplete, whose meaning is unknown. The bamboo books of the Warring States Period may have the form of placing " water " under the " wife ", see "Shangbo Bamboo Books III. Book of Changes, Jan 58.

The " sorrowful " of the bamboo slips of the Warring States Period can be read as " ji ", which means to go through. "Shangbo Bamboo Book II. "Rong Chengshi" Jane 31: "Plain in Guangchuan" refers to crossing a vast river. In addition, " Qi " is pronounced " ji " and can also be interpreted as " cheng " (Qiu Xigui), "Er Ya. Interpretation: "Ji, Cheng Ye." "Guodian Jian. Jane 25-26 of Chengzhiwenzhi: "The people who believe in words can be deplorable (de)", which means that winning the people's trust can achieve virtue.

"Shuowen": "Qing, the clouds and rain start. From the water, the voice of the wife. "The Poetry" said: "There is a miserable misfortune." " Yes ", which means " sorrowful " originally means the emergence of clouds with rain. "Han Shu" quotes "The Book of Songs. Xiaoya. "Da Tian": "There is a miserable misfortune", Yan Shi's ancient annotation: "A desolate, cloud looks also." The current "Book of Songs" is made "萋萋", "Mao Zhuan": "萋萋, the appearance of clouds."

" Qing " from Yunxing has the meaning of coldness, "The Book of Songs. Bei Feng. "Green Clothes": "It is sad with the wind." "Mao Zhuan": "The cold wind is also." Then the cold and cold lead to sorrow, "Han Shu. "Foreign Qi Biography": "Autumn Qi is full of tears, and the osmanthus sticks fall and die." Wang Xianqian added: "Lears and sternness mean the same thing."

humanum_full_description:
從「水」，「妻」聲。本義為帶雨之雲湧現(段玉裁)。

　　甲骨文從「水」從「妻」，唯卜辭辭殘，其義不詳。戰國竹書或有置「水」於「妻」下之形，參見《上博竹書三．周易》簡58。

　　戰國竹簡「淒」可讀作「濟」，指渡過。《上博竹書二．容成氏》簡31：「淒於廣川」，指渡過廣闊的河川。另「淒」讀作「濟」，亦可釋為「成」(裘錫圭)，《爾雅．釋言》：「濟，成也。」《郭店簡．成之聞之》簡25-26：「言信之于眾之可以淒惪(德)也」，是說取信於民眾可以成就德行。

　　《說文》：「淒，雲雨起也。从水，妻聲。《詩》曰：『有渰淒淒。』」段玉裁據《初學記》、《太平御覽》改為「雨雲起也」，指「淒」本指帶雨的雲湧現的意思。《漢書》引《詩經．小雅．大田》：「有渰淒淒」，顏師古注：「淒淒，雲起貌也。」今本《詩經》作「萋萋」，《毛傳》：「萋萋，雲行貌。」

　　「淒」由雲行引申有寒涼的意思，《詩經．邶風．綠衣》：「淒其以風。」《毛傳》：「淒，寒風也。」繼而再由寒涼引申出悲涼，《漢書．外戚傳》：「秋氣潛㠯淒淚兮，桂枝落而銷亡。」王先謙補注：「淒淚與淒厲意同。」

淒字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qī］
［《廣韻》七稽切，平齊，清。］
亦作“凄1”。
(1)云兴起貌。
(2)寒冷；阴凉。
(3)凄凉悲伤。
(4)水流貌。参见“淒淒”。
(5)沾湿貌。参见“淒淒”。
(6)草木盛貌。参见“淒淒”。
(7)象声词。参见“淒淒”、“淒鏘”。
(8)古代传说中的水名。
[②]［qiàn］
［《集韻》倉甸切，去霰，清。］
疾速。参见“淒2浰”。

淒字的康熙字典解释

【巳集上】【水字部】　淒； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页629第23
【唐韻】七稽切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】千西切，?音妻。【說文】雲雨起貌。【詩·小雅】有渰淒淒。　又寒涼也。【詩·邶風】淒其以風。　又水名。【山海經】翠山西二百五十里曰騩山，淒水出焉。　又【集韻】千咨切，音郪。亦雲雨起也。　又此禮切，音泚。義同。　又倉甸切，音蒨。淒浰，疾貌。或从倩作?。通作倩。【司馬相如·子虛賦】儵眒淒浰。徐廣讀。漢書文選作倩浰。
